op.description: Pre-existing Firefox Accounts metrics field used to identify Amplitude metrics events.

event_type.description: Event type in the format of 'GROUP - TYPE'.

user_id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

device_id.description: The unique identifier for the device.

country.description: The localized full country name where the locale is based (indirectly) on a request's `Accept-Language` header.

region.description: The localized full name of the province, state, or territory where the locale is based.

os_name.description: The name of the operating system.

os_version.description: The version of the operating system.

device_model.description: A unique name provided by the device manufacturer to identify the device type or design (e.g. 'iPad', 'iPhone' or 'Pixel 2 XL').

event_properties.description: Properties associated with a particular event, which values are current for the moment at which the event was triggered.

oauth_client_id.description: The OAuth client ID for a RP integrated with FxA.

user_properties.description: Properties tied to the FxA user. These values can reflect current or previous values, depending on its nature and how often it is updated.

entrypoint.description: The specific page or browser UI element containing the first step of the FxA sign-in/sign-up process (e.g., enter email form).

entrypoint_experiment.description: Identifier for the experiment the user is part of at the entrypoint (if any).

entrypoint_variation.description: Identifier for the experiment variation the user is part of at the entrypoint (if any).

utm_campaign.description: As defined by Google Analytics, this parameter is the individual campaign name, slogan, promo code, etc. for a product.

utm_content.description: As defined by Google Analytics, this parameter is used to differentiate similar content, or links within the same ad. This parameter can be used to track the name of an A-B test (i.e., if a particular call-to-action is resulting in more traffic).

utm_medium.description: As defined by Google Analytics, this parameter is used to identify the medium that directed the visitor to the page (e.g., utm_medium=email).

utm_source.description: Used to identify the site, or browser UI element that is sending traffic to the page containing the beginning of the FxA sign-in/sign-up process.

utm_term.description: As defined by Google Analytics, this parameter is used to identify the paid search keywords that led customers to a page. It can be used to track the cohort or variation in an A-B test (i.e., if a specific term sent more customers to a page).

if.$comment: For event_type's matching the pattern below, make language a required field
